classFeature.name: Artificial Spellcasting
entries: With ingenuity and knowhow, artificers are able to harness magic through technology.

entries.name: Spell Inventions
entries: Whenever you prepare an {@filter artificer spell|spells|class=Artificer}, you create a spell invention for that spell using your tools of artifice and whatever materials you have on hand.

A spell invention is a unique experimental device that is esoteric and useless to other creatures, but in your hands can be used to cast the spell it was prepared for. You prepare a number of spells with a spell level no higher than your maximum spell level (both as shown on the Artificer table) chosen from the artificer spell list.

You can change your list of prepared spells and replace or create new spell inventions whenever you finish a long rest by spending at least 10 minutes tinkering. Any spell inventions you've prepared previously are taken apart and integrated into the new ones, or fall apart due to a lack of maintenance. You can only have a maximum of 1 spell invention per spell you have prepared.

You do not have spell slots, and instead utilise your spell inventions to cast spells. Whenever you cast a prepared artificer spell using a spell invention, you may cast it at a spell slot level up to your maximum spell level as shown on the Artificer table.

You may freely draw a spell invention from your inventory as part of the same action used to cast a spell through it, and you may also freely stow any spell inventions you were already wielding using that same action.
Using a spell invention does not remove its spell from your list of prepared spells.

You can determine the exact form a spell invention takes but it weighs 500 grams per spell level and is no longer than 1 foot in any dimension (treat cantrips as 1st-level spells). A spell invention has an armour equal to half your Intelligence modifier, and a number of hit points equal to your artificer level x 3. You can fully repair your spell inventions whenever you finish a long rest, so long as you have access to your tools of artifice.

items.name: Fizzle Die
entries: After you cast a spell using a spell invention, you must roll a fizzle die, a {@dice d4}. If the result is less than or equal to the spell slot level used to cast the spell, your spell invention burns out, runs out of power, or otherwise malfunctions and cannot be used again until repaired. Your fizzle die improves by one step at 10th level (from {@dice 1d4} to {@dice 1d6}) and again at 20th level (from {@dice 1d6} to {@dice 1d8}), and it improves by one step when using a spell invention gained from your artificer subclass (maximum {@dice 1d10}).

items.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know to cantrips of your choice from the artificer spell list and construct a spell invention for each. Unlike your other spell inventions, using these does not require rolling a fizzle die. You learn additional artificer cantrips of your choice at higher levels and construct spell inventions for them, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Artificer table. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can replace one of the artificer cantrips you know with another cantrip from the artificer spell list.

items.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your artificer spells. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability.

items.name: Tools of Artifice
entries: You produce your spell inventions and infuse items with your tools which act as your spellcasting focus. After you gain the ability to infuse items at 2nd level, you can also use any item bearing one of your infusions as tools of artifice.

classFeature.name: Fizzle Die Improvement (d6)
entries: Your fizzle die increases from a {@dice d4} to a {@dice d6}.

classFeature.name: Fizzle Die Improvement (d8)
entries: Your fizzle die increases from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}.

classFeature.name: Craftsman
entries: Artificers often start out in creative or artistic trades. You gain an expertise die on Magiscience checks.

classFeature.name: Tactical Chemistry
entries: At 1st level, you know how to quickly turn inert chemicals into something violently reactive or useful in the moment. As a bonus action, you can create one of the following items:

Items you make in this way are extremely unstable and must be used immediately. If an item you create in this way is not used (activated, lit, thrown, or applied as appropriate to the item) by the end of your next turn it dissolves into useless sludge.

You can use this feature to create a number of items equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest. You cannot regain expended uses in this way if you don't have access to tools of artifice.

classFeature.name: Schematics
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can build all manner of things with the right tools and, most importantly, the schematics of what you're trying to make.

entries.name: Schematic Book
entries: You gain schematics for three common rarity magic items (https://a5e.tools/magic-items?field_mi_rarity_target_id%5B%5D=315&field_mi_cost_value%5Bmin%5D=&field_mi_cost_value%5Bmax%5D=&combine=) of your choice. A schematic is a collection of notes and diagrams that explains in detail how to create a specific magic item. These form your schematic book, and any future schematics you gain are added to it.

entries.name: Crafting with Schematics
entries: When you have the schematics for a magic item, you can craft it as part of a long rest by spending half of the item's default gold cost. You can only craft a single magic item per long rest without disrupting the rest. Crafting a magic item using a schematic does not use up the schematic in any way, and the schematic remains usable.

entries.name: Creating New Schematics
entries: You can attempt to create and add a new schematic for any traditional magic item (https://a5e.tools/magic-items) to your schematic book by spending 1 hour studying and 10% of the item's default gold cost in experiments and material tests. At the end of the hour make a DC 15 Magiscience check. On a success you create a new schematic of that magic item and add it to your schematic book, and on a failure the time and materials are wasted.

entries.name: Infusion
entries: Once you have sufficiently studied a magic item you can reproduce and temporarily infuse its magical properties into items through magitechnical ingenuity.
If you have the schematic for a magic item, you can use an action to create it.
You can infuse a number of items as shown on the Infusion Limit column of the Artificer table. You regain all expended infusion uses whenever you finish a long rest.

Items you infuse do not conflict with regular loot items for item slots, but do conflict with each other (for example, you cannot wear two helmets that you have infused, but you can wear an infused helmet and a helmet you looted). Additionally, a creature can only wear up to three infused items that require attunement at a time, and cannot wear multiple copies of the same item that requires attunement.

Any infused items you create vanish after you finish a long rest, but they can remain imbued indefinitely if you commit to regular upkeep. Whenever you finish a long rest you can maintain any infused items you have access to by expending one infusion use for each. Any infusions you fail to maintain vanish.

classFeature.name: Field Discoveries
entries: Experimentation is the key to scientific progress, and through your experiences and findings in the field you've discovered new skills and data. At 2nd level you gain one field discovery of your choice. The Field Discoveries column of the Artificer table shows when you learn more field discoveries. Unless otherwise noted, you can gain each field discovery only once.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 1st level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 5th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 7th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 9th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 11th level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 13th level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 15th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 17th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 19th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Additionally, you gain a feat.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: At 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: At 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: At 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: At 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Battlefield Smithing
entries: At 6th level, as a veteran combat-tinkerer you specialise in certain aspects of warfare. Choose one of the following.

entries.name: Armour Smithing
entries: During a short rest, you can spend 25 gold in materials to permanently add one of the following modifications to a suit of armour or change an additional modification:

items.name: Camouflaged
entries: A terrain type for this modification is chosen when it is crafted. The wearer gains an expertise die on Stealth checks while in that terrain.

items.name: Spiked
entries: A creature that begins its turn grappling the wearer takes 1 thorns damage.

items.name: Stealthy
entries: The armour has been disguised to look like a piece of clothing. A creature observing the item only realises that it is armour with a DC 15 Investigation check (made with disadvantage if the armour is being worn at the time).

items.name: Storage
entries: The armour contains a hidden compartment the size of a small vial that requires a DC 20 Investigation check to be found without knowledge of it.
A suit of armour can only have one additional modification.

entries.name: Weapon Smithing
entries: During a short rest, you can spend 25 gold in materials to permanently add one of the following modifications to a weapon or change an additional modification:

items.name: Flamboyant
entries: Creatures have disadvantage on any saves made to resist being distracted by the weapon, and the wielder has advantage on Intimidation checks made with the use of it.

items.name: Quickdraw
entries: The weapon can be swapped in or out as a free action once per turn.

items.name: Stealthy
entries: The weapon has been disguised to look like another normal item. A creature observing the item only realises that it is a weapon with a DC 15 Investigation check (made with disadvantage if the weapon is sheathed).

items.name: Storage
entries: The weapon contains a hidden compartment the size of a small vial that requires a DC 20 Investigation check to be found without knowledge of it. The compartment has a release that can be used as a bonus action to allow the liquid within the compartment to flow out and be applied to the weapon.
A weapon can only have one additional modification.

classFeature.name: Intellectual Calibre
entries: At 7th level, your attitudes and academic manners have cemented how you and your intellect are perceived by your peers. Choose one of the following.

entries.name: Kooky Eccentric
entries: Your excitement for your work is infectious and most find your quirky methodology inescapably endearing. You gain proficiency in Persuasion, or if you are already proficient in Persuasion you gain an expertise die instead. In addition, you can always choose to use Intelligence when making a Persuasion check.

entries.name: Sporadic Genius
entries: You're known for sudden bursts of insight and people listen to your fervorous insights. When you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an ability check or save, you can use your reaction to add your Intelligence modifier to the roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Stern Proctor
entries: Your demand for perfection extends past your own work, and with only a discerning glare and a few choice words you can make the confident feel foolish. You gain proficiency in Intimidation, or if you are already proficient in Intimidation you gain an expertise die instead. In addition, you can always choose to use Intelligence when making an Intimidation check.

classFeature.name: Advanced Tactical Chemistry
entries: At 9th level you've mastered and branched out from basic chemistry, discovering a new science to integrate into your tactics. You may add your Intelligence modifier to the attack rolls of any item you create using Tactical Chemistry. In addition, choose one of the following:

entries.name: Humanoid Biochemistry
entries: You've learned a great deal of biochemistry and what chemicals you can apply to alleviate many ailments. You can create the following additional items using your Tactical Chemistry feature:

entries.name: Toxin Synthesis
entries: You've learned the subtleties of toxins and can now rapidly produce foul and deadly substances. You can create the following additional items using your Tactical Chemistry feature:

classFeature.name: Trinket Master
entries: At 10th level you've mastered the simpler enchantments and technological principles. What once was careful trial and error has been replaced with factory-like efficiency and speed. Whenever you craft a magic item from a schematic that has a default gold cost of 50 or less, it can be done so in a short rest instead of a long rest.

classFeature.name: Reliable Spell Inventions
entries: At 11th level your practice has finally smoothed out the early faults of your spell inventions, so long as you keep the arcane power within acceptable parameters. Whenever you roll a 1 on the fizzle die, you may reroll it, if you do you must use the new result.

In addition, your spell inventions have become streamlined enough that other creatures can make sense of them. A creature holding one of your spell inventions can use an action to make a Magiscience check (DC equal to your standard DC). On a success the spell is cast at its lowest possible spell level, or on a failure the spell fizzles out and fails to cast. Whenever a creature attempt to cast a spell using one of your spell inventions in this way, roll the fizzle die as normal.

classFeature.name: Marvel of Innovation
entries: At 13th level you've managed to truly improve on something or create something new altogether, taking a solid step forward in the technological development of the world. When you first gain this feature, choose a newly invented foodstuff, object, or trade good that could conceivably be crafted. For example, you could invent carbonated sodas, glowing iridium glassware, or a fine mechanism for better performing pocket watches.
As part of a long rest, you can create your new invention for 5 gold worth of materials.
Any other uses your invention may have are at the DM's discretion, but its utility shouldn't exceed that of other mundane adventuring gear.
In addition, your notoriety as a great inventor spreads along with your invention. While you are in a region you've sold your invention in, you have advantage on Persuasion checks.

classFeature.name: Technological Attunement
entries: At 14th level you've managed to bypass many of the arcane roadblocks regarding magic item usage through the clever use of technology.

items: You can attune to up to 5 magic items created from schematics at once.
You ignore all race, class, level, and alignment requirements when attuning to or using magic items creature from schematics.
You gain an additional magical equipment slot for looted items. This can hold any looted items your body armour slot would usually be able to hold.

classFeature.name: Hotfixer
entries: At 17th level you've mastered the art of rerouting power, quick welds, and improvising on the spot to keep your spell inventions functional. When rolling the fizzle die would burn out one of your spell inventions, you can use your reaction to fix it and restore it to full working order. Once you repair a spell invention in this way you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Infusion Recharge
entries: At 18th level you've learned what makes magic items tick and how to charge them up on your own. While you are attuned to a magic item that uses charges, you can use a bonus action to expend one infusion use and restore up to {@dice 1d6} of that item's spend charges.

classFeature.name: Magical Automaton
entries: At 20th level you've managed to achieve what most inventions are truly designed for, making machines that do your work for you. Whenever you create a spell invention, you may spend 25 gold in material components and expend two uses of your infusion feature to transform that spell invention into a spell automaton that uses the {@creature spell automaton|sns} stat block and it is destroyed if it reaches 0 hit points.
The exact design of your spell automaton is up to you, and it may resemble a humanoid creature, a boxy contraption, or be a magical construct flowing with arcane energies.

Your spell automaton is a minion, and requires your concentration to maintain. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Block action and uses its move to avoid danger.

You can maintain this spell automaton as if it was an infused item, requiring both the prepared spell invention and two uses of your infusion feature. You can repair your spell automaton to full hit points during a long rest so long as your have access to your tools of artifice.

subclassFeature.name: Stitcher
entries: With the careful grafting of flesh and a dash of lightning, what once was dead may live again! Stitchers are artificers who delve into the marvelous mysteries of life, death, and reanimated flesh. Many stitchers begin in medical fields but once they see that dead flesh move for the first time it's hard to ignore the potential of magiscience. Stitchers may continue to work as doctors and mend the sick, though their true passion now requires corpses flesh as raw material for their experiments.

subclassFeature.name: Stitcher Spells
entries: At tier 1, when you prepare your artificer spells you can prepare certain spells and create spell inventions for them (or forgo them for modifications) in addition to your normal number of prepared spells. These spells count as artificer spells for you, even if they aren't on the artificer spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Monstrous Minion
entries: Also at tier 1 you learn the secrets of giving life to dead flesh and become able to create a monstrous minion.

You can create this monstrous minion by spending 8 hours of uninterrupted work on a humanoid corpse that has been dead no more than 24 hours. This monstrous minion is unique and its exact appearance is up to you. It is a minion and requires your concentration to maintain, though remains maintained while you are {@condition unconscious|sns} as well. Your monstrous minion won't attack except as a reaction to being attacked, but it can take other actions as normal and makes death saving throws.
On your turn you can use a bonus action to order your monstrous minion to perform an action.
Your monstrous minion is a {@creature zombie|sns} with the following improvements.

items: Your monstrous minion's type changes to construct.
Whenever your monstrous minion rolls initiative, it gains a number of temporary hit points equal to your artificer level squared.
Your monstrous minion's armour increases by an amount equal to half your proficiency bonus.
Your monstrous minion adds your proficiency bonus to its damage rolls.
Your monstrous minion regains all lost hit points at the end of a long rest so long as you tend to it with your tools of artifice.

entries: Whenever you finish a long rest, you can graft modifications onto your monstrous minion at the cost of infusion uses. These modifications only remain functional due to your infusions, and you can maintain these modifications as if they were infused items. Any modifications you fail to maintain are removed whenever you finish a long rest. You can install any of the following modifications at the cost of 1 infusion each.

entries.name: Exploding Bile
entries: Your monstrous minion does not make death saving throws, and the first time it would make a death saving throw it instead explodes and is destroyed. The minion makes a reflex attack against creatures within 10 feet of it when it explodes, dealing {@dice 3d4} poison damage. This damage increases to {@dice 6d4} when you reach 11th level.

entries.name: Extra Arms
entries: Your monstrous minion gains a climb speed of 20 feet. In addition, creatures attempting to escape from a grapple by your monstrous minion have a penalty equal to your Intelligence modifier on the save. You must have access to at least one humanoid corpse that has been dead no more than 24 hours to graft this modification.

entries.name: Extra Legs
entries: Your monstrous minion's Speed increases by 15 feet. You must have access to at least one additional humanoid corpse that has been dead no more than 24 hours to graaft this modification.

entries.name: Fine Stitchwork
entries: Your stitchwork is barely noticeable and with a heavy coat or similar accoutrements your monstrous minion can pass for a living creature. When you graft this modificaiton, make a Magiscience check. Creatures must make a Perception check with a DC equal to your check result to visually determine that your minion is a construct.

entries.name: Grafted Spell Invention
entries: When you prepare your spell inventions and modifications to your monstrous minion, you may choose to graft a spell invention into the monstrous minion. You may order your monstrous minion to cast a spell using its grafted spell invention, governed by your Intelligence instead of its own. You must roll a fizzle die as normal. Any grafted spell inventions are destroyed if the monstrous minion is destroyed.

entries.name: Grafted Weapon
entries: When you prepare your spell inventions and modifications to your monstrous minion, you may choose to graft a melee weapon onto one of its arms in place of a hand. The melee weapon must be able to be wielded with one hand. Your monstrous minion loses its Grab attack and gains an attack with the grafted weapon, which it becomes proficient with. You may retrieve weapons grafted in this way the next time you prepare modifications for this monstrous minion by removing it, or from its remains if it is destroyed.

entries.name: Infectious Bite
entries: Your monstrous minion's Bite attack deals an additional {@dice 1d4} ongoing necrotic damage on a hit that persists, but does not stack, until the target regains hit points or is medically administered to with a {@dc 15} Medicine check. This damage increases to {@dice 2d4} when you reach 11th level.

If the target is a beast, dragon, giant, humanoid, or monstrosity and it dies while suffering from this effect, it rises as a zombie after 1 minute, gaining the Zombie Template (https://a5e.tools/rules/zombie-template). Zombies created in this way are hostile to all non-undead and are not under your control.

entries.name: Shocking Coils
entries: Your monstrous minion has spearking coils protruding from its back. A creature takes {@dice 1d6} lightning damage when it hits your monstrous minion with a melee weapon attack. This damage increases to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 11th level.

entries.name: Thicker Skin
entries: Your monstrous minion's armour increases by 2.

entries.name: Vigor Mortis
entries: Your monstrous minion can take the Dash action as a bonus action. It can't do so again until it moves 0 feet on its turn.

subclassFeature.name: Stitcher Major Effect #1
entries: If the triggering attack dealt damage, your monstrous minion's attacks during its next turn deal additional damage of your attack's base type equal to double your level.
Otherwise, your monstrous minion gains +1 to all defences for 1 round.

subclassFeature.name: Corpse Storage
entries: At tier 2, you gain access to a pocket dimension where you can only store the corpses of creatures that died within the past minute. You can do so as an action while adjacent to such a corpse. The next time you take a long rest, any corpses in this dimension are expelled back into the material location where they first entered the pocket dimension.
You can remove a corpse from this pocket dimension as a free action once on each of your turns, manifesting it in an unoccupied space of your choice within 60 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Medical Sutures
entries: Starting at tier 3 you've turned your magiscience expertise towards first aid. You can create the following additional items using Tactical Chemistry:

items: bandage (used as a bonus action to end all ongoing damage on a creature)
healing satchel (used when you attempt to stabilise a dying creature with Medicine to set the minimum result of your check to 20)

entries: In addition, you can reattach a severed limb or body part. The limb or body part must be relatively intact and the injury must be no more than 8 hours old. The reattaching process takes 1 hour and requires a DC 14 Magiscience check. On a success the limb or body part is attached and functional with no further complications. On a failure the limb cannot be saved.

Alternatively, you can replace a lost limb or body part with a donor part. This donor part must be analogous to a missing part (an arm for an arm, a leg for a leg), and it must be from a humanoid creature of the same size. The reattaching process requires a DC 20 Magiscience check when performed in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Stitcher Major Effect #2
entries: You instantly create a blank mannequin-like construct corpse in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of you. It disappears at the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Grafting
entries: At tier 4 you've grown tired of wasting so many perfectly good monster parts and have learned how to integrate them into your creations. The following modifications are added to your list of modification options using your Monster Minion feture at the cost of two infusion uses instead of one.

entries.name: Dragon Gullet
entries: You must have access to the corpse of a dragon that has been dead no more than 24 hours to graft this modification. Your monstrous minion gains the following breath weapon attack.

items.name: Stolen Breath (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The monster exhales the putrid and infected gullet of a fallen dragon in a 30-foot cone. It makes a reflex attack against each creature in the area, dealing {@dice 2d10} necrotic damage and {@dice 2d10} damage of the type the dragon breathed in life.

entries.name: Giant Muscles
entries: You must have access to the corpse of a giant that has been dead no more than 24 hours to graft this modification. Your monstrous minion's Strength increases by 6. Note that its weapon attacks are governed by Strength.

entries.name: Grim Duplicate
entries: You must have access to the corpse of a humanoid that has been dead no more than 24 hours to graft this modification. Your monstrous minion has the face and features of the humanoid used to make this modification. When you graft this modification, make a Magiscience check. Creatures must make a Perception check with a DC equal to the result of your check to visually determine that your minion is not the humanoid used to create it, realising it is a construct on a substantial success.

entries.name: Monstrous Part
entries: You must have access to the corpse of a monstrosity with a CR no greater than half your artificer level that has been dead no more than 24 hours to graft this modification. Your monstrous minion gains a trait or attack unique to that monstrosity, such as the barbed tail (and tail attack) of a manticore or the head (and gaze attack) of a yeti. The parts of a monstrosity that can grant an attack or trait are at the DM's discretion.

entries.name: Risen Beast
entries: You must have access to the corpse of a beast with a CR of 1 or less that has been dead no more than 24 hours to graft this modification. Your monstrous minion uses the statistic of the beast with the Zombie Template (https://a5e.tools/rules/zombie-template), gaining the other improvements found in the Monster Minion feature as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Harness Death
entries: At tier 5 you've harnessed death - mostly. You gain the {@spell Inescapable Malady|sns} spell and when you prepare your artificer spells you can prepare it and create a spell invention for it (or forgo it for a modification) in addition to your normal number of prepared spells. This spell counts as a 5th-level artificer spell for you and you can cast it without the usual material components, but a creature you target with it cannot be targeted by this feature again.

optionalfeature.name: A Better Mousetrap
entries: There's always a better trap design if you put your mind to it. You can improve traps as you set them. Traps you improve in this way always have their damage die size increased by 1. This affects trap weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Prodigy
entries: You are a master of the alchemical arts and new mixes and concoctions come naturally to you. When you first gain this field discovery, you gain two schematics of your choice and add them to your schematic book. These schematics must be for potions of common or uncommon rarity (https://a5e.tools/magic-items?field_mi_category_target_id%5B%5D=302&field_mi_cost_value%5Bmin%5D=&field_mi_cost_value%5Bmax%5D=&combine=). In addition, you have advantage on checks made to create schematics for potions.

optionalfeature.name: Golden Ratio
entries: You've been taking exact measurements of both natural and magical specimens, and believe true expressions of both can be reduced down to mathematics. When you select this field discovery you may select two {@filter 1st-level spells from the druid spell list|spells|level=1|class=Druid}. These are considered artificer spells for you and you may add them to the list of spells you can prepare. If you are at least a 7th-level artificer when you select this field discovery, you may select 1st- or 2nd-level spells from the druid spell list instead. You may select this field discovery multiple times, choosing different druid spells each time.

optionalfeature.name: Modern Comforts
entries: With a little reengineering technology can alleviate all manner of discomforts. Whenever you begin a long rest you may repurpose one of your currently prepared spell inventions. If you do, that long rest counts as being in a Haven. You can determine the exact nature of this repurposed spell invention (some examples include using a {@spell burning hands|sns} spell invenction as a space heater or a {@spell shocking grasp|sns} spell invention as a bug zapper).

optionalfeature.name: Orienteering
entries: You always know to have a bit of magnet and a pin on you for orienteering emergencies. With 1 minute's work you can cobble together a makeshift compass. Compasses made in this way become useless after 1 hour and have no sale value. You're also adept at surveying your surroundings and you gain an expertise die on checks made to do so. In addition, you gain proficiency in Survival and an expertise die on checks made to find your way in the wilderness.

optionalfeature.name: Reengineering Nature
entries: An orderly mind can see all sorts of uses within the natural world. You may use Magiscience in place of Survival when setting up camps or gathering in the wilderness.

optionalfeature.name: Retraced Development
entries: Even if dumped into the wilderness with nothing you'd get a laboratory back up and running in no time. With 1 hour of work you can create ramshackle versions of your tools of artifice. You take a -2 penalty on checks made with these ramshackle tools and they have no sale value.

optionalfeature.name: Rope and Pulley Master
entries: Numerous logistic puzzles can be solved with just a rope, a pulley, and proper application of intellect. By spending 10 minutes working with at least 300 feet of rope, you can create the following through ingenious use of ropes and pulleys.

items: A rope system that provides safe travel over a gap of 50 feet or less. You must be able to access both sides of this gap to create a rope system in this way.
A rope system that allows a creature to lift an object of a weight up to 5x its carrying capacity directly up as far as 50 feet.
A rope system that allows a creature to drag an object of a weight up to 5x its carrying capacity as far as 50 feet.

A manual rope elevator that allows a single Medium-sized or smaller creature to travel up to 50 feet straight up and down as if it were difficult terrain (a tree, cliff wall, ceiling, or similar structure is required at the top of this elevator for the ropes to attach).

entries: You can also deconstruct and recover the rope used in any of these rope creations by spending 10 minutes tearing it down.

optionalfeature.name: Strategic Dismantling
entries: While you may have no special talent for detecting traps, you and your tools can definitely deal with them once they've been pointed out. You gain an expertise die in Magiscience checks to disable mechanical traps. In addition, if you trigger a trap while attempting to disarm it, its attacks have disadvantage against you.

optionalfeature.name: Tinker Toys
entries: Your mastery of locomotion and gearing allows you to easily infuse elements of motion into simple devices. As an action you can create and place a Tiny moving gadget called a tinker toy (such as a walking doll, flying whirlgig, or toy boat) out of 1 gold worth of materials. This tinker toy has 0 armour, 1 hit point, and your choice of a Speed of 10 feet, fly speed of 10 feet, or swim speed of 10 feet. When you place this device it begins moving in a straight line until it is destroyed, it is blocked by an obstacle, or you use a bonus action to pick it up again. Tinker toys made in this way weigh 1 kilogram, and can carry up to 500 grams worth of other devices or materials. Once you create a tinker toy in this way you cannot do so again until you finish a short rest, and any existing tinker toys you've created fall apart whenever you create a new one.

monster.name: Spell Automaton
languages: understands any known by its creator but cannot speak

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one target. {@damage 4d10 + 8} + double your Intelligence modifier bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Integrated Spell
entries: The automaton uses the spell invention integrated into it to cast a spell, governed by your Intelligence instead of its own. If the spell invention integrated into it would burn out due to the result of the fizzle die, the automaton takes 33 true damage instead.

bonus.name: Overclock (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The automaton takes the Dash action.

items: The zombie's Speed increases by 10 feet for 1 round.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude (1/Day)
entries: If the zombie is reduced to 0 hit points by damage that isn't radiant or from a critical hit, it's instead reduced to 1 hit point, falls {@condition prone|sns}, and is {@condition incapacitated|sns} until the end of its next turn, appearing to be dead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: A zombie doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

action.name: Grab
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one target. {@damage 1d6 + 1} bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled|sns}. Until the grapple ends, the zombie can't grab another target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} reach 5 ft., one {@condition grappled|sns} target. {@damage 1d10 + 1} piercing damage, and the zombie regains the same number of hit points.
